The spelling Vivian was historically used only as a masculine name, and is still used as such in the UK with this spelling, but in the 19th century was also given to girls and was a unisex name until the early part of the 20th century; since the mid 20th century, it has been almost exclusively given as a feminine name in the United States.

係大把

咁peter John ben 呢啲呢？係咪要上英文堂舉手同老師講：peter仔個名都唔係英文黎既

我只係想講：其實好多香港普遍用梗嘅英文名都唔係源自英文。既然被英語母語人士普遍使用，仲有冇必要去質疑佢係英文定唔係英文呢？

西: 差/BI/ER 尾音ER一樣都係高音

係大把

以我所知係現代好多地方話言都會有嗰26個字母，例如蝗語都有拼音。咁係j 呢個字母係英文，西班牙文，蝗拼都有唔同發音。咁 jose 好明顯係跟西班牙文。同埋你係邊學英文會學到個e 字上面有一劃

replies.msg:
呢個字無疑係借過黎，係外來語，但已經被廣泛視為英文嘅一部分。你dse考試寫Jose, resume呢啲字，marker都唔會捉你寫法文西班牙文啦

Keep in mind that英文係彈性好大嘅語言，7成5嘅英文字係外來字。

The spelling Vivian was historically used only as a masculine name, and is still used as such in the UK with this spelling, but in the 19th century was also given to girls and was a unisex name until the early part of the 20th century; since the mid 20th century, it has been almost exclusively given as a feminine name in the United States.

係大把
